prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Rounded Corners Construct a rectangular prism with rounded corners. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Next, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a loop (loop\\_1) containing four lines: * line\\_1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0], ending at [0.75, 0.75] * line\\_3: Starting at [0.75, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.75] * line\\_4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.0] Now, let's transform this 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.75 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 * sketch\\_scale: 0.75 The resulting shape is a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * length: 0.75 * width: 0.75 * height: 0.75 Part 2: Cylindrical Object with Tapered End Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, similar to a metallic tube or pipe. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.466, 0.2866] Next, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a loop (loop\\_1) containing one circle: * circle\\_1: Centered at [0.0937, 0.0937], with a radius of 0.0937 Now, let's transform this 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.466, 0.2866] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.75 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 * sketch\\_scale: 0.1875 The resulting shape is a cylindrical object with the following dimensions: * length: 0.75 * width: 0.1875 * height: 0.1875 For the final 3D model, combine these two parts. The first part, the rectangular prism, will serve as the base, while the second part, the cylindrical object, will be merged with the first part. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 1. Face 1: * Loop 1: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch using `sketch_scale` of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined above. Extrude the 2D sketch 0.245 units in the normal direction (towards the positive Z-axis) to generate the 3D model. Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. To build part 2, create a new coordinate system based on the coordinate system of part 1 with the following modifications: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.245] (tailored to the `extrude_depth_towards_normal` of part 1) Now, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of this new coordinate system. 1. Face 1: * Loop 1: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] * Loop 2: * Circle 1: Center [0.375, 0.375], Radius 0.275 Scale the 2D sketch using a `sketch_scale` of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined above. Extrude the 2D sketch while removing material (cut) by 0.1 units in the negative Z-direction (opposite the normal) to generate the 3D model of part 2. The final shape will be a tapered prism with a cylindrical hole in the center and will combine the elements of both parts. The dimensions of the intermediate parts are provided in the `description` sections.</description>
